title: class_c62
body:
The Class C62 (C62形) is a type of 4-6-4 [[steam locomotive]] designed by Hideo Shima and built by the [[Japan_Railways|Japanese National Railways]] ([[Japan_Railways|JNR]]). The "C" classification indicates three sets of driving wheels.

The C62 has achieved a level of fame due in part to the manga/anime series [[ginga tetsudou 999|Galaxy Express 999]], in which the express is pulled by an advanced space locomotive that is built to replicate a C62.

h4.  Examples 

* !asset #23103354: C62 steam locomotives hauling a tourist train
* !asset #23103358
* !asset #23103351: C62 2's Swallow Mark
* !asset #23103395: C62 2 with "[[ginga tetsudou 999|999]]" nameplate 
 
h4. See also

* [[Steam locomotive]]
* [[Japan Railways]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: JNR Class C62":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JNR_Class_C62

title: keikyoku_no_machi_wa_doko_e_(project_sekai)
body:
The 145th event of [[Project Sekai]]. The focus of this event is [[25-ji Nightcord de. (project sekai)|]]

Within the fandom, the event is often referred to as Mizu5, in reference to it being the fifth event featuring [[Akiyama Mizuki]] as a focus character. Became a "meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/mizu5], as Mizuki's shocked face in the event's featured card became a common reaction image following its posting by the Japanese [i]Project Sekai[/i] X account "teasing the event":[https://x.com/pj_sekai/status/1844574014326571513]. The event story's developments, which involved Mizuki being "apparently outed":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdh3kHkj17g] to [[Shinonome Ena]] as having been born a boy by two of their schoolmates, sparked significant debate within the [i]Project Sekai[/i] fandom as to the question of Mizuki's gender identity (which remains not officially confirmed).

[b]4 Stars[/b]
* [[Akiyama Mizuki]] - post #8290201
* [[Shinonome Ena]] - post #8349969
* [[25-ji KAITO]] - post #8349978

[b]Event Shop[/b]
* [[Asahina Mafuyu]] - post #8349947
* [[Yoisaki Kanade]] 

* !post #8290183: Mizuki's featured card

h4. See Also
* [[Bake no Hana (vocaloid)]]
* [[List of Project Sekai Costumes and Events]]

title: eternal_sunshine_of_the_spotless_mind
body:
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind is a 2004 American [[science fiction]] romantic drama.
Thee film stars [[Jim Carrey]] and Kate Winslet, with Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, [[Elijah Wood]], and Tom Wilkinson in supporting roles. The film follows two individuals who undergo a procedure to erase each other from their memories following the dissolution of their relationship.

title: short_hair_with_long_locks
body:
Hairstyles that would otherwise be classified as "[[short hair]]" if it wasn't for 1 or 2 locks of [[long hair]].
Keep in mind that these locks have the same length requirement as [[long hair]], so this tag should not be used for medium hair locks. 

If the locks are in the front, the [[sidelocks]] tag should also be used. 
If they are in the back, make sure that visually it is clear that the majority of the hair in the back is cut short and not simply drawn together into something like a [[ponytail]].


h5. Examples

h6. Front (positioned in front of the ears)

* [[White Heart (neptunia)|]]
* [[Yayoi (kancolle)|]]

h6. Side (positioned behind the ears)

* [[Jiritsu Shikou Kotei Houdai]]
* [[Musashi (kancolle)|]]
* [[Tachibana Marika]]

h6. Back

* [[Kako (kancolle)|]]
* [[Mitsumine Mashiro]]

title: miyu_edelfelt_(third_ascension)
body:
[[Miyu Edelfelt]] in her Third Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is what she looks like when she was originally part of the Sakatsuki clan, wearing her hair in multiple hair buns and a ponytail, adorned with multiple red bows and tassels. She wears a floral-print kimono, a white kimono shirt over the first kimono, a red pleated skirt, dark blue socks, and sandals. Magical Sapphire's appearance also changes from a short rod to a long staff with a hollow star at the top.

h4. See Also
* [[Sakatsuki Miyu]]

title: walter_white_cooking_(meme)
body: Walter White Cooking refers to a series of GIF caption memes based on a GIF of [[Walter White]] from the [[Breaking Bad]] series mixing chemical ingredients. The format gained popularity on Reddit in October 2021.

title: jesse_what_the_fuck_are_you_talking_about_(meme)
body: Jesse, What the Fuck Are You Talking About refers to a series of memes imaging conversations between [[Breaking Bad]] characters [[Walter White]] and [[Jesse Pinkman]], with Jesse using modern internet slang and Walter not understanding it and asking what he is talking about.

title: magical_sapphire
body:
A sentient [[wand]] known as a [[Kaleidostick]] that is [[Miyu Edelfelt]]'s partner. Magical Sapphire used to belong to [[Luviagelita Edelfelt]], but she abandoned Luvia and contracted with Miyu instead. [[Magical Ruby]] is her older sister.

In Illya's [[Prisma Illya (Zwei Form)|Zwei form]], she merges with Magical Ruby into a [[kaleidostick (zwei_form)|single kaleidostick]].

title: magical_ruby
body:
A sentient [[wand]] known as a [[Kaleidostick]] that is [[Prisma Illya]]'s partner. Magical Ruby used to belong to [[Tohsaka Rin]], but she abandoned Rin and contracted with Illya instead. [[Magical Sapphire]] is her younger sister.

In Illya's [[Prisma Illya (Zwei Form)|Zwei form]], she merges with Magical Sapphire into a [[kaleidostick (zwei form)|single kaleidostick]]. In Illya's [[illyasviel von einzbern (swimsuit archer)|Swimsuit Archer]] form, Magical Ruby is depicted as a water nozzle attached to a [[hose]].

title: kaleidostick_(zwei_form)
body: The merged form of [[Magical Ruby]] and [[Magical Sapphire]] from [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]]'s [[Prisma Illya (Zwei Form)|Zwei form]].

title: tippy_(gochiusa)
body:
A female [[Angora Rabbit]], and a prominent pet character from [[Gochuumon wa Usagi Desu ka?]] Appearance-wise, Tippy is little more than a white ball of fur with ears and a simple face (mostly like a cat head), and can usually be found riding on top of [[Kafuu Chino]]'s head. Her full name is based on the whole-leaf tea leaf grade Tippy Golden Flowery Orange Pekoe.

Throughout most of the series, the spirit of Chino's grandfather inhabits Tippy's body. She is often drawn with long eyelashes to show when she is just a normal rabbit, as in post #8344638.

body: [B]Dragon Quest Monster Battle Road Victory[/b] was a [[Wii]] port of the Monster Battle Road arcade games that was released in 2010. title: cynthia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Cynthia[/b], known as [b]Shirona[/b] (シロナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Champion of Sinnoh is an archeologist who researches the history and mythology of Pokémon. Her deep love for Pokémon sent her on an adventure when she was young [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Garchomp]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers one eye]]. She wears [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[fur collar]], a [[black shirt|shirt]] under a [[black coat|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[fur-trimmed coat]] with a [[v-neck]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels|heels]].

h4. Official art

title: darach_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Darach[/b], known as [b]Kokuran[/b] (コクラン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon platinum|Pokémon Platinum]][/i].

Darach is an adept Castle Valet with extraordinary insight. The secret to his strength is his ability to make decisions on the fly, which allows him to adapt to any situation [tn](official bio)[/tn].

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[two-tone hair|and]] [[blonde hair]]. He wears [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[glasses]], a [[white shirt]] with a [[black bowtie|bowtie]] under a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[white vest|vest]], a [[tailcoat]], [[white gloves]], [[purple pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #5198507

h4. See also

* [b]Voice actor[/b]
** [[Umehara Yuuichirou]] (Masters EX)

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Darach":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Darach]

title: cyrus_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Cyrus[/b], known as [b]Akagi[/b] (アカギ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

The leader of the evil Team Galactic. Believing the human spirit to be incomplete, he's trying to create a new world. Calm and logical, he's highly trusted by his subordinates [tn](official bio)[/tn].

He has [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blue hair]], and pronounced [[cheekbones]]. He wears a [[Team Galactic uniform]] consisting of a [[black shirt|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[shirt]] under an [[open vest|open]] [[grey vest|grey]] [[logo]] [[vest]], [[black pants]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]].

title: flint_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Flint[/b], known as [b]Ooba[/b] (オーバ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This member of the Elite Four is constantly on the verge of overheating. He's a skillful Trainer of Fire-type Pokémon who is always burning for an all-out battle [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Infernape]].

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] styled in an [[afro]]. He wears a [[black choker]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[yellow shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], [[black wristband|black wristbands]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[grey pants]] with a [[red belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #5454248

title: bertha_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bertha[/b], known as [b]Kikuno[/b] (キクノ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

Bertha is a mild-mannered Ground-type user and a member of the Sinnoh Elite Four. She aims for victory with her specialty—a steady, unyielding battle style [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She is [[old woman|old]], has [[brown eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with the sides [[flipped hair|flipped]] up . She wears a [[brown scarf]], an [[open coat|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[white coat]], a [[red shirt]], a [[black skirt]], [[grey pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #5324035

title: aaron_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Aaron[/b], known as [b]Ryou[/b] (リョウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

Aaron, a member of the Sinnoh Elite Four, aims to become a perfect Trainer who is as strong and beautiful as his beloved Bug-type Pokémon [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with [[hair between eyes|long bangs]] and an [[ahoge]]. He wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[zipper pull tab]], a [[white belt]], [[orange pants]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: fantina_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Fantina[/b], known as [b]Melissa[/b] (メリッサ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Gym Leader uses Ghost types and has made a reputation for herself in both contests and Pokémon battles. She is known for her avid study of Pokémon [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Mismagius]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] styled in [[quad tails]]. She wears a [[white choker]], a [[long dress|long]] [[purple dress]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves|elbow-length gloves]], and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[high heels|heels]].

title: crasher_wake
body:
[b]Crasher Wake[/b], known as [b]Maxi[/b] (マキシ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

A Gym Leader who uses Water-type Pokémon, Crasher Wake is beloved by his many fans for his passionate performances [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Floatzel]].

He is [[muscular male|muscular]], has [[black eyes]], and dark [[brown hair]] including a [[beard]]. He is [[topless male|topless]] and wears a [[mask]], [[orange wristband|orange]] [[wristband|wristbands]], [[two-tone leggings|two-tone]] [[blue leggings|blue]] and [[black leggings|black]] [[skin tight|skin-tight]] [[leggings]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[boots]].

title: lisia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lisia[/b], known as [b]Lutia[/b] (ルチア) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon oras|Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire]][/i].

Lisia is Hoenn's number one contest [[idol]] along with her [[Altaria]], Ali. She has a natural knack for contests and is also a hard worker-something her fans adore her for.

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[aqua hair]]. She wears cotton [[arm warmers]], an [[overskirt]] with [[white shorts|white]] [[shorts under skirt|shorts underneath]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[striped legwear|striped]] thighhigh, and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

h4. Official art

title: winona_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Winona[/b], known as [b]Nagi[/b] (ナギ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

This Gym Leader loves bird Pokémon more than anything. She has passionate fans in the Fortree City Gym thanks to her graceful appearance. Her signature Pokémon is [[Altaria]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[helmet]], a [[long sleeves|long sleeve]] [[pilot suit]], [[gloves]], [[white pants]], and [[shoes]].

title: wattson_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Wattson[/b] (Japanese: [b]テッセン[/b] Tessen) is the Electric-type Gym Leader of Mauville City, located in the Hoenn region of the [[Pokemon]] franchise. He first appeared in [i][[pokemon_rse|Pokémon Ruby and Pokémon Sapphire]][/i] and his signature Pokémon is [[Manectric]].

* In [[Pokemon RSE]], Wattson wears a [[brown sweater]] over his [[yellow jumpsuit]] and [[black_footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

* In [[Pokemon ORAS]], Wattson wears a [[green_shirt|green]] [[lightning bolt print]] [[shirt]] over his [[yellow jumpsuit]] and [[multicolored_footwear|multicolored]] [[flip-flops]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #4088530: [[Pokemon RSE|RSE]]
* !post #4088531: [[Pokemon ORAS|ORAS]]

title: roxanne_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Roxanne[/b], known as [b]Tsutsuji[/b] (ツツジ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

An honors student at the Trainers' School and a proud, skillful Gym Leader, she loves Rock—type Pokémon and fossils. Her signature Pokémon is [[Probopass]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey dress]], [[pantyhose]], and [[shoes]].

title: d-16_(transformers_one)
body:
A fictional variable geometry robot character from the Transformers mechaverse.

He is a re-imagined version of the original Transformers: Generation 1 Megatron of a closer lore towards his path to tyranny and revenge.

Started as a miner, a non-transforming robot who's friends with Orion Pax, he himself united as Brothers. He acquired the transformation cog later on by the power of Alpha Trion. [spoiler] D-16 later evolves into Megatron as he sees Orion's heavily damaged body, but Megatron let off the body and killed Sentinel Prime by splitting him in half (a reference from the 2007 movie)
He's also the one who started the movement and the faction known as "[[Decepticon]]s" [/spoiler]

title: orion_pax_(transformers_one)
body:
A fictional variable geometry [[robot]] character from the [[Transformers]] [[mecha]]verse.

He is a re-imagined version of the original [[Transformers: Generation 1]] [[Orion Pax]] but with a different origin.

Started as a miner, a non-transforming robot who's friends with D-16, [[Elita One]] and Bumblebee, he later gets a Transformation Cog from the power of Alpha Trion and later the [spoiler] Matrix of Leadership from the depths of the core of Cyberton. [/spoiler]

title: miyu_edelfelt_(black_dress)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Miyu Edelfelt]] worn during [i] Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA☆ILLYA 3rei!![/i]. She wears a [[backless dress|backless]] [[black dress]] with a [[halterneck]], black [[elbow gloves]], and a blue [[waist bow]]. Her hair is done in a [[side ponytail]] with a blue [[hair flower|flower]] and a [[butterfly hair ornament]]. Typically portrayed [[barefoot]].

* !post #2700784: [[Divine Gate]]

title: destiny_child
body:
A Korean gacha mobile game developed by Shift Up. 

You play the role of a demon who lives in the human world working as a part-timer. Alongside "children," familiars born from human desire, you contend for the throne that Lucifer has left empty. 

Its servers was shutdown on the 21st September 2023.

Not to be confused for the former American R&B girl group, "Destiny's Child":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Destiny's_Child].

h4. Characters

h4. See also
* [i][[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]][/i]
* [i][[Stellar Blade]][/i]

h4. External links
* "Official site (KR)":http://www.destiny-child.com
* "Official site (JP)":http://www.destiny-child.jp
* "Official site (JP PC version)":https://dmg.destiny-child.jp

title: cowboy_western
body:
As in, the Western film genre. These are depictions of the Wild West and its characters.

This tag is mostly used on pictures having the iconic [[cowboy hat]] and other appropriate leather clothing items (particularly [[boots]], [[chaps]], and [[vest]]s). If you can see guns in the picture, they are usually [[revolver]]s ([[Colt Single Action Army]] usually) or [[rifle]]s ([[Winchester model 1894]] usually). [[Native American]]-styled characters might also apply in tagging Western artworks.

For male characters, use [[cowboy]].

h4. See also
* [[Sheriff (western)]]

h4. External links 
* "Wikipedia - Western (genre)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_(genre)]

title: eunectes_(arknights)
body:
[i]Eunectes, Gavial's rival, steps onto the battlefield along with "Irritable Ironhide."[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Zumama

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Sargon[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Pythia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]171 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

The leader of a tribe that resides in [[Gavial (Arknights)|Gavial’s]] hometown, Acahualla. She was admitted into Rhodes Island after passing the operator examination and began receiving treatment at the same time. Currently active in the battlefields with her trusted companion, the [i]Raging Ironhide[/i]. An expert in engineering and robotics and maintains a peculiar relationship with [[Lancet-2 (Arknights)|]].

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]The Great Chief Returns[/i].

On top of the Ironhide, she also uses an axe and a shield during combat.

Her motif is based on [[anaconda|anacondas]]. Her callsign is derived from the genus of South American semiaquatic snakes.

She may be seen with a bird called [[High Priest (arknights)|High Priest]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kuwashima Houko]].

h4. Skins

title: sir_billiam_iii
body:
Antagonist of [[Tales from the SMP]]: The Masquerade, played by [[Technoblade]]. He is the owner of the mansion the titular masquerade takes place in. He is a rich and arrogant [[furry|anthro]] [[pig boy|pig]] who is also a wanted criminal. He is ambivalent to the murders that take place throughout the episode, caring only for potential damages to his property value.

He wears a [[black suit]] and a black and gold [[carnival mask]].

[spoiler]He later reveals himself to be working alongside the [[blood vines (dream smp)|]] in order to give the Egg nourishment.[/spoiler]

title: sazabi
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

From the movie [[Char's Counterattack]], the [[Neo Zeon]] [[Sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]] is the personal [[mobile suit]] of [[Char Aznable]] and was one of the most advanced mobile suits of its time in U.C. 0093, together with [[Amuro Ray]]'s [[nu gundam|RX-93 Nu Gundam]]. Both mobile suits are equipped with the revolutionary [[Psycho Frame]] technology. Its mechanical designer in [[real life]] is [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

Sazabi's body is all red with a single green eye, yellow thrusters, yellow hoses, and yellow insignias and emblems adorning its body. It is equipped with a [[beam rifle]], two [[energy sword|beam sabers]], a beam tomahawk, a [[shield]] containing missiles, a beam particle gun on the torso and six [[funnels (gundam)|]]. Its head resembles Char's helmet from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

h4.See also

* [[Nu Gundam]]
* [[Sinanju]]
* [[Nightingale (gundam)|]]
* [[Varguil]]

title: kshatriya
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]] from 2010.

[b]NZ-666 Kshatriya[/b]

An evolution of the [[Neo Zeon]] [[Quin Mantha]], also referred to as the Quad-Wing due to its four wing-like structures containing funnels. As a Newtype use massive [[Mobile Suit]], it was lined with the mysterious psycoframe around its cockpit, much like the [[Sazabi]] and [[Nu Gundam]] before it. It was piloted by [[Marida Cruz]]. 

Despite its popularity and prevalence in the [[Gundam Unicorn]] series, the Kshatriya infamously never received a much-requested Master Grade model kit (most probably due to its weight, a problem that afflicted the massive [[Nightingale (gundam)|]] until it was released as part of the RE/100 line), prompting many fans to make fake box art of the supposed kit which was never announced.

title: debimbofication_(meme)
body:
Parodies based on a fetish artwork of a reverse [[bimbofication]] sequence by [[sortimid]], in which a [[gyaru]]-esque bimbo character picks up a book and becomes a plain-looking student. The image went viral after being reposted to Twitter, largely due to the reposter and viewers misreading it as social commentary and not realizing that it was simply niche fetish art.

The meme saw a resurgence in popularity several years later, as artists began to depict the before and after versions of the girl in the sequence as a [[yuri]] couple. The original artist themself also "supported the trend":https://twitter.com/Sortimid/status/1137376029536849920 as part of [[LGBT pride]] month.

h4. Origin
* !asset #21312168

h4. External Links
* "Know Your Meme: Bimbofication":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/subcultures/bimbofication]

title: ms_saga
body:
[b]MS Saga: A New Dawn[/b] is a 2005 [[PlayStation 2]] [[video game]] in the [[Gundam]] franchise. The game features [[mecha]] from assorted entries in the franchise, including the early UC entries, [[Gundam Wing]], and [[G Gundam]] alongside an original story, cast, and world. The English version of the game is fairly rare, and physical copies go for about $125-$150 on eBay.

The game is known as [b]Gundam True Odyssey[/b] in Japan.

Original character designs by [[Yasuda Akira]].

title: skeppy
body:
A [[Minecraft YouTube]]r who is a member of the [[Dream SMP]]. He is commonly paired with [[BadBoyHalo]].

h4. Appearance
His Minecraft skin is an anthropomorphic diamond block with a derpy [[:p]] expression. Fans often depict him in a [[humanization|humanized]] form borrowing from his IRL appearance instead. This design has [[dark skin]], [[black hair]], and usually either [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[brown eyes]]. He is typically shown wearing a [[blue hoodie]] and [[blue hat|blue]] [[beanie]], and occasionally a box head with the design of his Minecraft skin.

title: badboyhalo
body:
A [[Minecraft YouTube]]r and member of the [[Dream SMP]] and [[Quackity SMP]]. He tries to keep his content family-friendly and prefers not to swear. He is commonly paired with [[Skeppy]].

In Dream SMP, he is the leader of the Badlands and Eggpire factions, and is a chaos-stirrer with a friendly exterior who secretly wants power and control. He is the first and main host of the [[blood vines (dream smp)|]], which slowly corrupt his thoughts and lead him to committing atrocities he would later regret. 

In Quackity SMP, he is friendly and one of the primary caretakers of the dragon eggs, often babysitting them. His son is [[dapper (quackity smp)|Dapper]], an egg with a top hat. Bad is highly suspicious of the island and of the Federation.

h4. Appearance
BadBoyHalo is a [[demon boy]] with [[black skin]] and [[white eyes]], along with [[horns]] and a [[demon tail]]. His standard outfit consists of a [[black hoodie]] with a red trim, [[black pants]], a brown [[strap]] across his chest, and a checkered [[grey neckerchief]].

h5. Default skins

* !asset #22469373: [[Purgatory (quackity smp)|]]

title: addams_family
body:
A franchise focusing on the titular Addams, a rich but peculiar family, created by Charles Addams for the [i]Saturday Evening Post[/i].

h4. Installments
* The original newspaper illustrations by Addams, in which the family isn't named
* The 1967 American television series
* The 1973 and 1992 Hanna-Barbera animated adaptations
* The 1990s film continuity
* The 2019 and 2021 animated films
* [i][[Wednesday (netflix)|]][/i]: Spinoff focusing on Wednesday Addams as she attends a boarding school

h4. Characters
* [[Gomez Addams]]: The patriarch
* [[Morticia Addams]]: The matriarch
* [[Pugsley Addams]]: The only son
* [[Wednesday Addams]]: The only daughter
* [[Pubert Addams]]: The youngest of the Addams
* [[Uncle Fester]]: The family's eccentric uncle figure. Relation to Gomez or Morticia changes with the adaptation
* [[Lurch (addams family)|]]: A [[Frankenstein's Monster]]-esque servant of the Addams
* [[Cousin It]]: A shaggy creature also considered a relative
* [[Thing (addams family)|]]: A disembodied hand
other_names: アダムス・ファミリー

title: svirepy_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Russian destroyer [i]Svirepy[/i]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair|dark blue hair]] tied into large [[double bun]]s plus an [[ahoge]] and [[grey hair|grey]] single [[streaked hair|streak]], and [[yellow eyes]]. 

Her default outfit is a [[Soviet school uniform]] comprising of [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[black dress]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[red neckerchief|red]] [[pioneer neckerchief]], [[white apron]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[single leg pantyhose]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh]], and knee-length [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and two 130 mm single [[cannon]] mounts, one of each per side. She also uses a [[PPSh-41]] [[submachine gun]] as a sidearm. 

h4. Skins

title: rina-chan_board
body:
The [[sketchbook]] or digital [[mask]] used by [[Tennoji Rina]] from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]].

Rina is not good at conveying emotions on her face. Because of this, she makes use of the "Rina-chan Board", a sketchbook that she draws her emotions on. 

Another variation is the "Auto Emotion Convert Rina-chan Board", a digital pixel mask that uses a [[dot-matrix]] display that instantaneously reacts to her emotions on the fly without having to read her face, and is capable of emulating lip movements accurately, useful on stage and other activities that require both hands.

title: adidas
body:
A major German [[sportswear|sports apparel]] manufacturer. Besides sports [[shoes|footwear]], the company also produces other products such as bags, shirts, and other sports and clothing related goods. The company is the largest sportswear manufacturer in Europe and the second largest sportswear manufacturer in the world.

The company's clothing and shoe designs typically feature three parallel bars.

title: gebel_(bloodstained)
body:
Original host for the magi-crystal curse that summons demons to the planet. Gebel was the only one to survive its effects at such a high level. 
He destroyed the guild that created him, but in doing so realized he was no longer human and had no place on Earth. 
This in turn, lead him to summon the demon castle from hell to appear on the planet.

It is said that his real purpose in summoning the castle was to give Miriam a place of her own, but as his Magi-crystal disease progressed, he soon forgot his own reasoning. 
The more he surrounded himself with hell-spawn, the quicker the magi-crystals engulfed his body. 
He continues to plot the downfall of man, and how to best convince (or use) Miriam to achieve his dark ambition.

title: nanami_chiaki
body:
Character from [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]]. Her title is Ultimate Gamer (超高校級の「ゲーマー」).

She has [[flipped_hair|flipped]] pink or light brown [[medium hair]] with a hairclip, and pink eyes. She wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[brown skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]], a [[pink_ribbon|pink]] [[neck ribbon]], and a black and white [[dress shirt|dress]] [[collared shirt|shirt]] that is [[shirt tucked in|tucked]] in her skirt. She has a [[hooded jacket]] that's shaped like a [[cat hood]] and she carries a pink [[backpack]], that's shaped like a [[cat bag]]. 

As the Ultimate Gamer, she loves video games of all kinds, and playing so many games has given her a wide range of general knowledge. Because of this you mostly see her [[holding handheld game console|holding and playing on a handheld game console]]. She's playing [[Galaga|Galaga Omega]] for the most time of the day and wears a hair ornament dedicated to the game. When she's not with [[Hinata Hajime|Hinata]] or [[Komaeda Nagito|Nagito]], she's sometimes seen with [[Monomi (Danganronpa)|Monomi]] by her side.

[spoiler]In Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair she is actually an artificial intelligence. Her creator and "father" was [[Fujisaki Chihiro]], the Ultimate Programmer from [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]] who programmed her A.I. for the Neo World Program.

[[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|Danganronpa 3]] reveals her to be based off of an actual Nanami Chiaki, who was part of Class 77-B and was executed by [[Enoshima Junko]] to push the rest of the class into despair. In this show she's wearing the [[Hope's Peak Academy School Uniform]]. She also wears [[loafers]] instead of [[mary janes]].[/spoiler]

Like other Danganronpa Girls, she has an official [[Playboy bunny]] outfit. She wears a [[two-tone leotard|two-tone]] [[white leotard|white]] and [[black leotard]], [[fishnet thighhighs]] and a [[rabbit hood|bunny hood]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears|bunny ears]].

h3. Official Costumes

title: dark_link
body:
[[Dark persona]] of Link from [[The Legend of Zelda]] series.

He first appeared as the last boss of [[Zelda II: The Adventure of Link]].  In this form he appears as Link's shadow:  a completely black figure with Link's profile.

Dark Link reappears as the Water Temple midboss in [[the legend of zelda: ocarina of time|The Ocarina of Time]]. A fan favorite fight. In addition to being three-dimensional, he now comes in varying shades of black and dark gray and has [[red eyes]].

Also an antagonist in the GBA remake of [[the legend of zelda: a link to the past|A Link to the Past]]. Bonus boss in [[the_legend_of_zelda:_spirit_tracks|Spirit Tracks]].

title: kaijin
body:
A relatively broad term in Japanese encompassing any fictional human-like character that possesses supernatural abilities (literally meaning "mysterious person"), usually used to refer to villains. Related to [[kaiju]], insofar as possessing monstrous traits or abilities, albeit usually human-sized and humanoid in appearance. Examples in Japan include the titular characters from Toho's Transforming Human Series films ([[slime boy|The H-Man]], The Secret of the Telegian and The Human Vapor), [[Godman]], and many characters in the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise (including some of the Riders themselves), while Western examples include [[Frankenstein's Monster]].

On Danbooru, per the broad definition, kaijin can be depicted in various fashions: [[monster boy]]/[[monster girl]], [[cyborg]], [[alien]], etc. Use the appropriate tag for the specific kaijin.

title: aphmau_(series)
body:
Refers to multiple series of scripted [[Minecraft]] roleplays created by the YouTuber Aphmau, usually set within the same overarching world. The series are often inspired by anime and employ tropes from it.

For the Final Fantasy character Aphmau based her name off of, see [[Afumau (final fantasy)]].

h4. Series
* [[Minecraft Diaries]]
** [[MyStreet]]
** Phoenix Drop High
* My Inner Demons
* VOID Paradox

title: dissidia_final_fantasy
body:
Crossover fighting game of the [[Final Fantasy]] JRPG series for the [[PlayStation Portable]] developed and published by [[Square Enix]].

A sequel/prequel, [i][[Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy]][/i], was released in March 2011. A team-vs-team spinoff, [i][[Dissidia Final Fantasy NT]][/i], first developed in arcades in 2015, was later ported to [[PlayStation 4]] and Steam (platform). A tie-in [i]gachapon[/i] RPG, [i][[Dissidia Final Fantasy Opera Omnia]][/i], was released concurrently, and still receives updates and new characters.

h4. Fighting for [[Cosmos (dff)|]]

title: mare_(ac8231)
body:
ヴィ@ac8231's OC character
Has commissioned countless artwork of her 
https://skeb.jp/@ac8231

https://x.com/ac8231/status/1774969507611881696
Mare Lunaris

The high-ranking vampire of the Moon Palace is a loyal servant of the former Demon King and is now the actual ruler of the Demon World. Contrary to what many believe, she does not consider herself the new Demon King and is still quietly waiting for her master's return. The Demon World is in chaos as she refuses to rule despite occupying the palace. She is prepared to mercilessly kill anyone who sets her sights on her master's throne.

Rumor has it that she has a twin sister, but the truth of this is unclear.

title: mogeko_castle
body:
[b]Mogeko Castle[/b] is a surreal comedy-horror game developed and illustrated by [[Funamusea (artist)|]], originally released on April 1, 2012 as a RPG Maker 2000 game. It was later remade in the RPG Maker VX Ace engine in 2014 and released on March 5. A sequel known as [i]General Hashasky's Great Adventure [b](ハスハスキー将軍の大冒険)[/b][/i] was teased after the release of Mogeko Castle's remake, however, it is yet to be released.

title: portrait
body:
An image primarily of the face of a character. It should not fall significantly below the armpits or past the character's chest/[[breasts]]; if it does, use the [[upper body]] tag instead.

Do not use this tag for [[cropped shoulders]] from [[multiple views]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20300572

h4. Related tags

* [[close-up]]
* [[upper body]]
* [[cowboy shot]]
* [[full body]]

h4. See also

* [[painting (action)|]]
* [[portrait (object)]]
* [[split crop]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

title: full_body
body:
An image focused on a character's full body. The character's entire body is visible and takes up most of the frame.

It still counts if minor appendages or accessories aren't fully in frame, such as hair, clothing, wings, or tails.

It doesn't count if the character is far away or doesn't take up most of the frame. See [[wide shot]] or [[very wide shot]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #1155601

h4. See also

* [[feet out of frame]]
* [[head out of frame]]

title: kimkoh
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[monster]] from the [[Contra]] [[video game]] series.

It first appeared in the [[Super Contra]] [[arcade]] title from 1988 where it acts as the final boss of the game.

[b]Kimkoh[/b] (陰獣 キムコウ [i] Kimukou[/i] or "Shadow Beast Kimkoh") is a recurring boss in the Contra series. It is a large arthropod-like alien creature that somewhat resembles a cicada during its nymph phase, but whose body is composed by what appears to be an amalgamation of many other creatures (including a large humanoid face). It seemingly occupies a high rank among the lines of the [[Red Falcon (contra)|]] [[army]].

Originally, there was a single Kimkoh encountered per game, although later appearances added multiple individuals of its kind in some titles. This brings into question whether the name "Kimkoh" refers to the name of an individual creature or of a whole species, with the latter being the more plausible option. While they usually retain similar behaviors and attack patterns, their body shapes and sizes differ greatly between titles.

title: kamen_rider_spirits
body:
[[Kamen Rider]] manga following the original ten Kamen Riders, set after [[Kamen Rider Super-1 (series)|]] and serving as an extended adaptation of the special [[Kamen Rider ZX]] debuted in. Began its original run on Monthly Magazine Z in 2001, and moved to Monthly Shounen Magazine in 2009, where it has been running ever since (under the title Shin Kamen Rider Spirits).

An oft-referenced page in the manga is found in Chapter 3, "One Man Battle (Part II)", with page 22, along with the quote from the page 「なあ・・・ 信じてみないか。たとえ神も仏も居なくても・・・ 仮面ライダーは居る、ってな・・・」(Hey... won't you believe in him? That even if there is no God or Buddha... there is Kamen Rider...)

title: yami_sheryl
body: A [[Yami Q Ray]]-styled dark counterpart to [[Sheryl Nome]], revealed as part of a 2024 [[Macross Frontier|Frontier]]/[[Macross Delta|Delta]] crossover merch release.

title: tomita_mana_(goma_ayakaze)
body:
Reika's best friend, who lives a life unrelated to the supernatural or the mystical.

In contrast to Reika, she is good looking and has a good personality.
She treats everyone equally and kindly, which creates a lot of misunderstandings.

She is weak, so she is a character who can only be controlled in special situations.
She is only protected by Reika and does not seem to have any powers...

title: ayakaze_reika_(goma_ayakaze)
body:
A hunter apprentice whose adoptive father is a "hunter" who slays monsters that harm people.

Contrary to her appearance, she has a problem with her mouth and personality, and
her emotions are obvious on her faces, and she thoroughly provokes people she dislikes. She is the main playable character in this game , and struggles to protect her best friend Aina

with her natural athletic ability and the mysticism that she borrows from the power of her enchanted sword .

title: zone-tron
body:
The [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] persona of the artist [[Zone (artist)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8141470: Reference sheet

title: goma_ayakaze
body:
It's a world similar to ours, but where the darkness of the night is indeed riddled with monsters.

Reika Ayakaze, an apprentice "hunter" who strikes down the monsters that threaten the people of the world, one day, she learns that an unfamiliar pattern is appearing on her best friend, Mana Tomita.

Reika and Mana start to investigate the pattern.
However, what awaits them are evil who are after Aina and countless monsters attracted by the pattern......

With the cursed demon sword "Rin" that has been passed down in the Ayakaze family, Reika's battle begins.

R-18 CRPG

title: self-cannibalism
body:

Does not apply to cannibalism between [[dual persona]]s.

title: walkman_e_series
body:
Series of [[digital walkman|Walkman player]]s from the 2000s designed to be entry-level products for an affordable price.

These models tend to fall into one of two camps: Either a buttonless, large screen device with a rounded shape, or a more traditional yet still "rounded candy bar" shaped player with the distinctive three-button Walkman control scheme.

title: jack-in-the-box
body: A toy consisting of a [[box]] and a crank. Turning the crank plays a tune, and at the end of the tune, a spring-loaded figure pops out.

title: meloetta_(prototype)
body: A [[prototype design|prototype]] version of [[Meloetta]] discovered in the [[2024 Pokemon Teraleak]].

title: kaburion_(pokemon)
body: An unused [[Pokemon (creature)|]] discovered in the [[2024 Pokemon Teraleak]]. It was supposed to evolve from [[Karrablast]].

title: omegamon_zwart
body: A Holy Knight [[Digimon (creature)|]]. It is the result of [[Omegamon]] absorbing a quantity of the obscure material, "Black Digitron", turning its appearance black. However, it is still an honorable and inherently good Digimon, as evidenced by its Vaccine attribute remaining unchanged - so unwavering is Omegamon Zwart's justice that even if it is created by the Jogress Evolution of [[BlackWarGreymon]] and [[MetalGarurumon (Black)]], it will suppress its constituents' Virus attribute and retain its status as a Vaccine.

title: kson_(party_dress)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Kson]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/pkenshiq/status/1729063933112455448].

Becoming a model, she wears a [[grey sweater]] with a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[black skirt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels|high heel]] [[thigh boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streakes]] in it, that she wears either loose, or in a [[ponytail]].

title: digital_walkman
body:
[[Sony]]'s line of [[digital media player]]s and a direct competitor to the [[iPod]]. Not to be confused with the original [[Walkman]] cassette players.

One of their defining traits is the three-button control scheme with one large button in the middle and two smaller ones over top.

Do not tag Sony unless the Sony/Walkman branding is visible.

h4. Types

* [[Walkman B Series]] - Line of thumb drive players
* [[Walkman E Series]] - Affordable line with a rounded candybar shape
* [[Walkman NW-S203F]] - Cylindrical shaped
* [[Walkman W Series]] - Wearable line

h4. See also

* [[CD Walkman]]
* [[Sports Walkman]]
* [[Walkman]]

title: sports_walkman
body:
Small portable [[radio]] by [[Sony]] under the Walkman umbrella. Rectangular with no screen, often branded as "Sports Walkman AM" or "Sports Walkman FM".

h4. See also

* [[CD Walkman]]
* [[Digital Walkman]]
* [[Walkman]]

title: pools_(game)
body:
A 2024 horror walking simulator developed by Finnish developer Tensori. It is an interactive adaptation of "liminal space":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liminal_space_(aesthetic)], set in a vast, labyrinthine pool complex.

h4. External links
* "Steam: POOLS":https://store.steampowered.com/app/2663530/POOLS/

title: suiko
body:
Ambiguous tag.

* The Japanese pronunciation for [i]Shui Hu[/i] (水虎, "Water Tiger"), a [[creature]] from "The Compendium of Materia Medica":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compendium_of_Materia_Medica].

** For some monsters/characters based on suiko/shui hu, use "suiko_(any_copyright_names)":/tags?commit=Search&search[category]=4&search[hide_empty]=yes&search[name_matches]=suiko_%28*&search[order]=count&utf8=%E2%9C%93 tags. E.g. [[Suiko (Youkai Watch)]].

body:

title: gensou_suikoden
body:
An RPG series by [[Konami]] which revolves around the concept of the "108 Stars of Destiny" (108 recruitable characters, all of whom must be found and kept alive to get the best endings) and "27 True Runes" (magical items that grant immense magical power and immortality to their human hosts, usually with rather unpleasant side effects). So far there are five main games and three spinoffs, along with novelizations and manga adaptations of the main five.

It is loosely based on the Chinese novel [[Water Margin]] ([i]Water Margin[/i]).

h4. Games

* [[Gensou Suikoden I]]

* [[Rhapsodia]]
* [[Gensou Suikoden Tierkreis]]

title: masturbation
body:
Masturbation is the act of stimulating one's own erogenous zones (most notably the [[pussy|vulva]] —including the [[clitoris]]/[[labia]]/vaginal-opening— in females, the [[penis]] in males, and the [[nipples]] of both genders) with the aim of sexual self-gratification, whether alone or in the company of others. Masturbation need not conclude in [[orgasm]].

This tag is typically not used when the masturbation in question is part of another sex act, such as [[bukkake]] (see forum #79127).

[[crotch_rub|Crotch rubbing]] is often used as a method of masturbation, especially by women. Other [[tag group:sex objects|sex objects]] may be used (usually by women), such as [[vibrator|vibrators]], [[dildo|dildos]], etc. Men sometimes use [[artificial vagina|artificial vaginas]] or other sex toys, as well. title: pointless_censoring
body:
[[censored|Censorship]] in an image that completely fails to properly conceal the object in question, or is located on the place where there is nothing worth censoring.

Examples include:
* [[Bar censor]] that barely obscures the object
* [[Mosaic censoring]] at such a high resolution that it appeared as uncensored while the image is not zoomed in

A complete lack of censorship is generally frowned on by Japanese publishers due to the self-censorship policy as a result of the Article 175 of the Japanese law forbidding all kind of pornography within Japan, so artists will use techniques seen here in order to avoid confrontation or prosecution.

h4. See also

* [[Fake censor]]
* [[Censored identity]]

title: mickey_mouse
body:
The most recognizable [[Disney]] character, being the de-facto mascot of the company.

He is an anthropomorphic [[mouse (animal)|]] created by [[Walt Disney]] and Co. His character design consist of round black ears, [[white gloves]] [[red pants]] with two yellow buttons, and large [[yellow footwear|yellow shoes]].

His round head and ears have become a trademark symbol; done in a [[silhouette]], and often hidden in pictures as a running gag. His [[dark persona]] version often produces a vicious, characteristic laughter "(“ハハッ”).":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/2690686 

Within the Japanese community, he is often depicted with [[censored identity]] as a spoof to the late 2000s court cases involving Disney Japan suing the fan artists for copyright infringement, which spawned a local meme involving applying the censor across his eye and calling him an "unrelated" character.

Mickey appears with other Disney characters in the video game series [i][[Kingdom Hearts]][/i].

h4.See also

* [[Bugs Bunny]]
* [[Minnie Mouse]]
* [[Mickey Mouse ears]]
* [[Steamboat Willie]]
* [[takobue]]

title: smudge_tool
body:
Intentionally [[distortion|distorting]] an image with an effect similar to smudging one's finger across the page, causing colors and shapes to distend across the image. 

This may give a [[melting]] or [[dissolving]] effect.

In digital art, this is usually achieved with a smudge tool (or 'smear tool'). However, the smudge effect may also be drawn manually, in a manner that mimics the tool (Example 1).

h4. Examples
* !post #7777879: A hand-drawn "smudge" effect"
* !post #7763567: Used to employ [[horror (Theme)|]] elements
* !post #4508429: Used as an [[censored identity]]

h4. See also
* [[Image warping]]

title: ao_dai
body:
The [b]ao dai[/b] (Vietnamese: áo dài) is a [[Vietnam]]ese national costume, now most commonly for women. It is a two-part outfit consisting of a long tunic (often looking similar to a dress) and trousers. The top is usually tightly fitted with a high or [[mandarin collar]] and is often made of bright colors and decorated with floral patterns. The trousers are typically made of silk, with a contrasting color to the top.

title: splatoon_2
body:
Second installment of [[Splatoon (series)|]], released in 2017 for the [[Nintendo Switch]]. Was stylized as "Spla2n" before the official sequel announcement.

The game launched with three gameplay modes, those being [b]Turf War[/b], a multiplayer mode that plays similar to Multiplayer Mode in the first game, [[Salmon Run (splatoon)|]], a multiplayer mode which involves teams of inklings going to a remote island to hunt power eggs, and [b]Hero Mode[/b], a single-player story campaign focusing on the new [[squidbeak splatoon]] member [[Agent 4 (splatoon)|]] as they help [[Marie (splatoon)|]] look for her missing partner, [[Callie (splatoon)|]]. After launch, a fourth mode was added as DLC, [[splatoon 2: octo expansion|Octo Expansion]], a single player mode set after Hero Mode where an amnesiac [[octoling player character|octoling]] sets out to escape an underground facility.

title: mc_championship
body:
Monthly [[Minecraft]] [[esports]] tournament series organized by Noxcrew and [[smajor1995|Scott Major]] that began in 2019. In the event, [[Minecraft YouTube]]rs compete in a variety of minigames in teams of four. It is a non-commercial tournament series for fun, prioritizing the ability for its players to show off their skills in a friendly competition instead of for a cash prize.

Artwork often depicts participants in team-themed outfits, as each team is assigned a color and animal.

There are also recurring "non-canon" or spinoff events, such as MCC Rising (an event for up and coming creators), MCC Pride (an annual charity event run in collaboration with The Trevor Project), and Jingle Jam (an annual charity collaboration with the [[Yogscast]]). 

In 2024, the organizers collaborated with Mojang to run the Ender Cup for the game's 15th anniversary.

h4. Teams

Each event features ten teams of four players, each represented by a color and an animal. These are often represented in in-game team skins and fanart, where players may be [[kemonomimi mode|given animal features]] matching their team.

* [[Red Rabbits (mc championship)|]]
* [[Orange Ocelots (mc championship)|]]
* [[Yellow Yaks (mc championship)|]]
* [[Lime Llamas (mc championship)|]]
* [[Green Geckos (mc championship)|]]
* [[Aqua Axolotls (mc championship)|]]
* [[Cyan Coyotes (mc championship)|]]
* [[Blue Bats (mc championship)|]]
* [[Purple Pandas (mc championship)|]]
* [[Pink Parrots (mc championship)|]]

h4. See also

h4. External links

title: queen_(band)
body:
[b]Queen[/b] are a British rock band formed in London in 1971, originally consisting of [[Freddie Mercury]], (lead vocals, piano), Brian May (lead guitar, vocals), John Deacon (bass guitar), and Roger Taylor (drums, vocals). 

Queen's initial works were chiefly glam rock, heavy metal and progressive rock orientated; however, over time, the band began to incorporate a range of diverse and innovative styles in their music, exploring the likes of vaudeville, electronic music and funk.

title: mike_tyson
body:
[b]Michael Gerard Tyson[/b] (born June 30, 1966)

An [[united states|American]] [[boxer]] and previously the undisputed world heavyweight champion.

Mike Tyson was used to promote the [[NES]] port of the [[Nintendo]] [[arcade]] game [[Punch-Out!!]] while he was the World Heavyweight Champion. Nintendo lost its license to portray Mike Tyson and because he was no longer the World Heavyweight Champion, the company decided not to renew the contract and instead replace him in later releases of the game with the fictional character, Mr. Dream.

In 2021 he became something of a [[meme]] with [[Hololive]] fans, due to a frequent superchatter with the username "Eating Mike Tyson's Ass" getting many of the members to say their name.

A swordswoman from Yan, she travels the country to right wrongdoings and to fight evil to bring justice.

Her family were river pirates who raided merchants and got wiped in a governmental raid, which included [[Chongyue (arknights)|]]. For five years, she travelled thousands of kilometers to reach Yumen, the city where the latter lives, to exact vengeance.

In the end, he ended up training her swordmanship skills and she forgoed her desidere for revenge.

Her motif is based on the North China sika deer.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kotobuki Minako]] (Japanese), Cai Haiting (Chinese), Angel Lin (English), and Jo Hyun-jung (Korean). Her art designer is [[Wenquangua]].

It features a [[brown jacket|brown]] [[military uniform|military-style uniform]], [[white shirt|white]] [[pinstripe shirt|pinstripe]] [[dress shirt]], and a [[pleated skirt]].

title: magical_ruby_(hose)
body: [[Magical Ruby]]'s [[hose]] form, seen in [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Swimsuit Archer)]]'s [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Swimsuit Archer) (First Ascension)|first]] and [[Illyasviel von Einzbern (Swimsuit Archer) (Second Ascension)|second]] ascensions. She is attached to a [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped [[hose reel]] that Illya rolls around with her.

title: shaq_timeout_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a photograph of [[Shaquille O'Neal]] doing the [[time-out_(gesture)|time-out gesture]] against a grey backdrop.
The photo was originally taken for Robert Kraft's #Timeout Against Hate movement in October 2024

title: tenkyuu_chimata
body: The God of the Unowned 6th stage boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. A god with the ability to relinquish ownership of a traded item, effectively making her the god of physical marketplaces. Chimata has [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[rainbow gradient]] [[multicolored hairband]] atop her [[short_hair|short]], [[blue hair]]. While frequently missed or left out by artists, her hair also contains imagery of a [[cloudy sky]]. Her [[multicolored_clothes|multicolored]], [[patchwork clothes]] are held together with [[zipper|zippers]], and she adorns herself with a large [[cape]] with a [[sky print]] contained inside. She also wears a pair of [[pink_footwear|pink]] [[boots]]. She has a [[belt pouch]]. Her unique choice of clothing is the brunt of jokes, and has led her to be depicted with another [[hecatia_lapislazuli|goddess also infamous for her unique fashion sense]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Chimata Tenkyuu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Chimata_Tenkyuu

title: iizunamaru_megumu
body: Chief of the Crow Tengu Stage 5 boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]] and primary antagonist alongside [[Tenkyuu Chimata]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She may have [[pointy ears]] because she's a tengu, although they're not shown in official art. She usually wears a blue [[tokin hat]], a [[blue dress|blue]], [[ribbon trim|trimmed]] [[frilled dress]]. Over it, a [[shoulder guard]] with a [[gem]] on it, keeping in place a trimmed [[sleeveless coat]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s. She wears [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs|knee-high socks]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] or [[purple footwear|purple]] [[tengu-geta]]. She can be seen [[holding tripod|holding]] a [[tripod]]. Due to her Ability Card, she is also often depicted with [[onigiri]]. She's a daitengu, and is presumably the superior of [[Shameimaru Aya]] and [[Himekaidou Hatate]]. h4. External Link * "Touhou Wiki: iizunamaru Megumu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Megumu_Iizunamaru

title: idolmaster_cinderella_girls
body:
An extension of the [[Idolmaster]] franchise designed for mobile devices, using the Mobage social gaming platform, in which you may raise and battle your idols against other players.

Cinderella Girls later expanded with rhythm game [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls Starlight Stage]].

In addition to the original iDOLM@STER girls, the game adds many more new characters, for a total of over 180 idols. These 180+ characters are then divided into three categories, Cool, Cute, and Passion. Cool signifies cool and beautiful types, Cute signifies cute and princess types, and Passion signifies energetic and sexy types.

The game was released November 28, 2011. It ended service on March 30, 2023.

title: idolmaster_million_live!
body:
An extension of the [i][[Idolmaster|iDOLM@STER]][/i] franchise designed for mobile devices. The original used the GREE social gaming platform, in which players would raise and battle their idols against other players.

In addition to the original [i]iDOLM@STER[/i] girls, the game adds many more new characters, all designed by A-1 Pictures, which produced the [i]iDOLM@STER [/i] anime.  These characters are then divided into three categories, Dance, Visual, and Vocal.

In [i]Million Live![/i], these idols are collectively known as the 765 Million Stars, and are presented as effectively being part of 765 Production.  Additionally, unlike [i][[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i], all starting [i]Million Live![/i] idols already have seiyuu and a CD.

It received a communication and rhythm game based spinoff, [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days]], that also introduced two more idols and an assistant.

Bandai Namco Entertainment announced, beginning in December 2017, the original game would be systematically shut down, and service ended March 19 the next year. 
[I]Theater Days[/i]  continues to receive updates and support as the main game.

h4. Characters

(*) = from [i]iDOLM@STER [/i]


All idols were categorized into the Dance (Blue Diamond), Visual (Yellow Star), and Vocal (Pink Heart) attributes.
In [i]Theater Days[/i], they are categorized into Princess (Pink Crown), Fairy (Blue Snowflake), and Angel (Yellow Wing) attributes.

title: grabro
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

[b]MAM-07 Grabro[/b]

Also known as the [b]Grublo[/b], it is an underwater [[mobile armor]] designed along similar lines as a [[submarine]], but uses [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] technology to increase its mobility and make it a more effective anti-ship weapon. It was mainly designed for underwater combat mounting torpedo launchers for ship-to-ship or ship-to-shore assaults. 

The Grabro was piloted by Flanagan Boone.

title: gerald_robotnik
body:
The grandfather of [[Maria Robotnik]] and [[Dr. Eggman]]. A renowned scientist who was widely acknowledged as one of the greatest scientific minds of all time, Gerald was responsible for several groundbreaking creations, such as the [[Space Colony ARK]], the [[Biolizard]] and his greatest creation, [[Shadow the Hedgehog]].

Over fifty years prior to the events of [[Sonic Adventure 2]], Gerald was asked to lead Project Shadow, a medical program for researching immortality, which he accepted in hopes of finding a cure for a fatal illness afflicting Maria. [spoiler]Eventually, Gerald managed to create Shadow the Hedgehog, though not without drastic measures; he was taken into custody by the military when his work was deemed too dangerous. When learning that Maria had been killed by the military, Gerald slipped into madness and spent his last days plotting revenge against humanity.[/spoiler]
other_names: ジェラルド・ロボトニック

title: v_legs
body:
A subset of [[spread legs]] where both legs are bent so as to form a V shape over the upper torso. This is most common when a character is [[on back|on their back]] or when [[jumping]] and kicking both of their legs up for a split second. Note that the knees should be either minimally bent or not at all, so that the full length of the leg forms a V shape, not just the upper legs.

If you can see both upper legs but only one lower leg (post #1508826), do not use this tag since you don't know what the other lower leg is doing.

This tag should not be used for when the character is standing - in this instance, use [[legs apart]].

h4.See also

* [[spread legs]]
* [[folded]]
* [[knees to chest]]
* [[legs over head]]

title: rogue_(x-men)
body: Rogue is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], commonly in association with the [[X-Men]]. Created by Chris Claremont and Michael Golden, she first appeared in [[avengers (series)|Avengers]] Annual #10 (1981). In her comic book appearances, Rogue is depicted as a mutant, a subspecies of humans born with an "X-gene" that grants superhuman abilities. She is capable of absorbing the life force, attributes, memories, and superpowers of anyone through physical touch. She may then use these powers, abilities, and knowledge as her own for a period of time after releasing her target. Rogue is initially portrayed as a reluctant supervillain, but she soon joins the X-Men as a superhero and has since endured as one of its most prominent members.

title: caramelldansen
body:
A [[sweden|Swedish]] dance/techno song by Caramell. The song's title translates to [i]The Caramel Dance[/i].

The song spread quickly on the Internet, after a sped-up version by DJ Speedycake was paired with a dancing [[Mai (popotan)|]] and [[Mii (popotan)|]] from [[Popotan]] in a Swedish-made fan-edited flash video (post #113333), which was later reposted to Nico Nico Douga. The dance is called "ｳｯｰｳｯｰｳﾏｳﾏ(ﾟ∀ﾟ) ([i]U-u-uma uma[/i])" or "ウマウマダンス ([i]Uma uma dance[/i])" in Japan, spreading even further there following [[Exit Tunes]] obtaining the rights to the song from the original producers, releasing the original and sped-up remix to great success.

The vast majority of posts under this tag reference the visual part of the flash, which comes from the opening animation of the Popotan game and has nothing to do with the Caramell song. Interestingly however, later on, Caramell (or rather their producers) did put out follow-up music videos of the song featuring anime/manga inspired personas, known as the [[Caramella Girls]], doing the dance, with the exact same tempo as the original edit.

h4. See also

* [[meme]]
* [[Leekspin (meme)|]]
* [[Caipirinha (meme)|]]
* [[Paffendorf]]
* [[Get Down (meme)|]]
* [[Un tan]]

title: bokukawauso
body:
[[Original]] [[otter]] character drawn by [[Uchida Shuu]] as a concept character for [[Kancolle Arcade]] (see post #3442956). Name (as Uchida herself wrote on her illustration) literally means "I'm an Otter." The paper otter was later made into a real life [[mascot]] for the 2019 [[kantai_collection|KanColle]] Zuiun and Reppu Paradise Festival at the Yokusuka Seaside Paradise Amusement Park.

h4. See also

title: kirin_kai-ii
body:
A wacky looking [[original]] [[giraffe|Giraffe]] character drawn by [[Miyakawa Wakana]] as a concept character for [[Kancolle Arcade]], created together with [[bokukawauso|Bokukawauso]]. Name (as Miyakawa herself wrote on her illustration) literally means "Giraffe Kai Ni." Together with [[bokukawauso|Bokukawauso]], the paper giraffe was later made into a real life [[mascot]] for the 2019 [[kantai_collection|KanColle]] Zuiun and Reppuu Paradise Festival at the Yokusuka Seaside Paradise Amusement Park.

title: hiro_(darling_in_the_franxx)
body:
Protagonist of [i][[DARLING in the FRANXX]][/i]. Nickname is based on his designation as "Code:016".

Has [[blue eyes]], [[black hair]], and wears a [[school uniform]] that includes [[legwear garter]] when not wearing his [[black bodysuit]], which is also a [[mecha pilot suit]]. 

His [[aged down]] self is most often depicted wearing a [[fur-trimmed coat]] with a [[parka]], which is a [[grey coat]] that is also a [[winter coat]]. His [[boots]] are also  [[fur-trimmed boots]] as well. 

Hiro also [spoiler] grows a pair of [[blue horns]] [/spoiler] later in the series, in episode 17. Because that last element of Hiro's character design is a spoiler in itself, pictures of Hiro with that late addition to his appearance [i]must[/i] be tagged with [[spoilers]]. 

Along with [[zero_two_(darling_in_the_franxx)|Zero Two]], the pair pilot the Franxx [[Strelizia]].

title: synergetic_suit
body:
A type of [[mecha pilot suit]] seen in [[Soukyuu no Fafner]]. The suit is [[skin tight]] and has exposed segments along the [[shoulder cutout|shoulders]], [[hip vent|hips]], and waist. These exposed segments are injected with a series of needles during operation to allow the pilots to interface with the Fafners and the Siegfried system.

They are usually dark blue or green, with the only notable exceptions being [[Makabe Kazuki]] and [[Toomi Maya]]'s suits, which are grey and pink respectively. Kazuki switches to the traditional blue suit in later entries, while Maya retains her trademark pink suit.
other_names: シナジェティックスーツ

title: saijo_juri
body:
A rough-speaking girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is a member of the [[Houkago Climax Girls (idolmaster)|]].

A cool and boyish girl. Her use of words is rough so others are often afraid of her, but she's pure at heart and has trouble being honest. Second-year in high school.

Voiced by [[Nagai Mariko]]

title: komiya_kaho
body:
Kaho is friendly and tall but young girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] and the youngest idol in the game. She is a member of [[Houkago Climax Girls (idolmaster)|]].

Her interest in [[tokusatsu]] has led to her being grouped with other idols with the same interest.

Voiced by [[Kouno Hiyori]].

A free-spirited and elusive subculture type girl with glasses. She's a beauty who catches on easily and can talk with people she meets for the first time without feeling daunted. First-year in college.

Voiced by [[Kisui Shio]], replacing the retired [[Narumi Runa]].

A soldier from school of Zeno in Moscow, Russia. Also known as [b]The Barents Witch[/b], she uses a jet-looking magic broom named [b]Su-01вe[/b] to fly around and fight the enemies. She has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[long hair]], and usually wears [[aviator cap]] with [[animal ears]], [[goggles]], [[oxygen mask]], [[green shirt]], [[brown jacket|brown]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]], and [[short shorts]] with [[star ornament]].

title: luthar_(fate)
body:

In her [[Abigail Williams (Swimsuit Foreigner) (First Ascension) (Fate)|first ascension]], it appears as a black bumpy-skinned creature with an orange flared opening on its head. In her [[Abigail Williams (Swimsuit Foreigner) (Second Ascension) (Fate)|second ascension]], it appears as a smooth-skinned gray creature with a five-petaled opening on its head.

Not to be confused with other generic cats that often are depicted alongside [[Abigail Williams (Fate)|]].

title: strapless_shirt
body:
A [[shirt]] that doesn't have any straps, neck, or sleeves. The shoulders and upper chest area are left [[bare shoulders|bare]].

A strapless shirt is similar to a [[tube top]], but not exactly the same. A tube top is generally shorter and has a tighter fit, while a strapless shirt is usually longer and looser. A tube top usually wraps tight around the breasts and doesn't cover the [[midriff]], while a strapless shirt usually covers the stomach and doesn't conform as tightly to the breasts.

This tag may be used for strapless shirts with [[detached sleeves]], but not for [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] or [[off-shoulder shirt]]s. A [[sleeveless shirt]] has a neck but no sleeves; an [[off-shoulder shirt]] has sleeves but no neck; a strapless shirt has neither.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #5864842
* !post #2871553
* !post #8017970

h4.Incorrect examples
The following examples are [[off-shoulder shirt]]s, [b]not[/b] strapless shirts:
* !post #6610868
* !post #5255284
* !post #7655461


h4. See also

* [[tube top]]
* [[strapless]]
* [[sarashi]]
* [[bandeau]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

body:
A small and very cute [[white bird]] from the [[Project Moon]] universe. Don’t piss it off, or it will reveal a nasty surprise: [[stomach mouth|a massive maw extruding from the red spot on its tummy]].

It is one of the three Bird abnormalities, along with [[Judgement Bird]] and [[Big Bird (project Moon)|]]. [spoilers]If all three are out and about at the same time, they’ll wander towards a [[gate]] that spawns, wherein they’ll fuse into the secret fourth Bird abnormality, [[Apocalypse Bird]].[/spoilers]

She mysteriously disappeared ten years before Akko attends to Luna Nova. She is teaching astrology in Luna Nova under the alias of [[Ursula Charistes]].

body:
A [b]balaclava[/b], also known as a balaclava helmet or ski mask, is a form of headgear that covers the whole head, exposing only part of the face. Often only the eyes or eyes and mouth are left exposed. Typically worn by criminals or [[S.W.A.T.]] operators.

title: crescent_beam
body: An attack performed by [[Sailor Venus]], where a pair of crescents form back-to-back above her. She points her index finger upon the crescents to energize her finger, then aims at her target and fires a thin golden beam of energy from the fingertip. In the second season's first arc of the 90s anime, this attack gets a temporary upgrade called Crescent Beam Shower.

title: academic_test
body:
A graded sheet of paper commonly filled out and feared in schools.  

In Japan, slash ("/", often drawn like a check mark "✓") and X mark (×, ✗) are for missed answers, and circles (○) denote success. 

This tag should generally be used for actual paper tests, (usually with scores plain to see,) and not more metaphoric tests of characters, like needing to pass an obstacle course to qualify for a job.  Tag what you can see. 

h4. See Also

* [[hanamaru]]
* [[test score]]

title: darunia
body:
A supporting character in [[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]]. The patriarch of the [[Goron]] tribe, Darunia is a strong, bighearted man with a love of music. Once the "Sworn Brother" of the King of Hyrule, he severed ties with him after he allied with [[Ganondorf]], who attacked his tribe and threatened their livelihood. After [[Link]] aides him, Darunia appoints him as his new Sworn Brother and rewards him with the Goron's Ruby.

Seven years later, Link discovers that Darunia is in fact the new Sage of Fire, and that he named his son after the boy who saved his tribe.

Darunia returns as a playable character in the spin-off title [[Hyrule Warriors]], where he fights using a giant hammer and fire.

h4. External links

* "Zelda Wiki: Darunia":[https://zeldawiki.wiki/wiki/Darunia]

title: furry_and_animal
body:
[[Furry]] characters co-existing with normal, non-anthropomorphic [[animal]]s. 

Coincidental background wildlife such as bugs and most birds do not by themselves qualify, unless featured with anthropomorphic characters of the same species. It also does not apply to canonically anthropomorphic [[Pokemon (creature)|]] such as [[Lucario]] being pictured with a non-humanoid Pokemon.

The characters also have to be interacting or at least existing in the same space, not simply being drawn on the same canvas.

Sometimes humorously focused on, especially in the case of a furry character having a [[pet]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8127199
* !post #7843821

h4. See also

* [[person and animalization]]
* [[creature and personification]]

title: keffiyeh
body:
A traditional Middle Eastern square-shaped headdress which is generally worn on the head or around the neck like a scarf. Traditionally white with black or net-like red pattern.

There are many different terms to refer to it:

* keffiyeh or kufiya (Arabic: كوفية‎ kūfiyyah, meaning "from the city of Kufa" (الكوفة); plural كوفيات kūfiyyāt)
* ghutrah (غُترَة)
* shemagh (شماغ)
* ḥaṭṭah (حَطّة)
* mashadah (مَشَدة)
* chafiye (Persian: چَفیِه‎) 
* dastmal yazdi (Persian: دستمال یزدی‎)
* cemedanî (Kurdish: جه مه داني‎)

h4. See also
* [[agal]]
* [[Arabian clothes]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: yogscast
body:
British entertainment company - specifically a group of online video creators, that formed in 2008 and incorporated in 2011. Found initial success through [[Minecraft]] content, particularly early roleplay series such as Shadow of Israphel, but has largely moved on to other types of content.

Their Yogscast Games subdivision published the game [[Plate Up!]], among others.

Some members of the group are [[virtual youtuber]]s, such as Honeydew (as Clooba) and [[InTheLittleWood]].

* "Wikipedia: Yogscast":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yogscast

title: jean_grey
body: Jean Elaine Grey-Summers is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer Stan Lee and artist/co-plotter Jack Kirby, the character first appeared in The [[X-Men]] #1 (September 1963). Jean Grey is a member of a subspecies of humans known as mutants, born with superhuman abilities. She was born with psionic powers. The character has also been known as Marvel Girl, Phoenix and Dark Phoenix at various points in her history

title: the_wolverine
body:
The Wolverine is a 2013 superhero film featuring the [[Marvel]] Comics character [[Wolverine (x-men)|]].
It is the sixth installment in the [[X-Men film series]], the second installment in the trilogy of Wolverine films after [[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]] (2009), and a spin-off/sequel to [[X-Men: The Last Stand]] (2006).
Following the events of X-Men: The Last Stand, Logan travels to [[Japan]], where he engages an old acquaintance in a struggle that has lasting consequences. Stripped of his healing powers, Wolverine must battle deadly samurai while struggling with guilt over [[jean grey|Jean Grey's]] death.

title: tensai_majo_no_maryoku_kare
body:
Slice of life manga created by "Moto tsujima":[https://twitter.com/tuji_sima_motto]

The story is a boomerang love-comedy that revolves around [[nayu_(tensai_majo_no_maryoku_kare)| Nayu]], who's a bit of a [[mesugaki]] but also a powerful witch that lost all her MP and now has to deal with a life without using magic and Komugi, one of her past students but also the only person that likes her for who she is and who she now depends on. 

With many situations of comedic karma after [[nayu_(tensai_majo_no_maryoku_kare)| Nayu]] past exploits with an equal amount of acceptance brought by Komugi with many other characters appearing.
other_names: 調子に乗った天才魔女の魔力が枯れるお話

title: hoshiguma_(arknights)
body:
[i]Hoshiguma, member of the Special Service of Lungmen Guard Department, is awaiting your orders.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 20[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Oni[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]184 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An elite Operator from the Special Ops Team of the Lungmen Guard Department. She exhibited remarkable professionalism in handling violent crime, protecting VIPs, disaster response and emergency rescue. Currently a defender assisting Rhodes Island operations, she provides tactical execution and command support.

Uses a spinning triangular shield named [i][[Hannya_(Arknights)|Hannya]][/i].

Her character design bears somewhat of a resemblance to [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]] from [[Touhou]], but her horn is off-center, as if the horn meant to be on the other side of her head is missing. Moreover, their names are also a reference to one of [[Shuten Douji (Mythology)|Shuten-doji's]] top lieutenants.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Yasuno Kiyono]] (JP), Cai Xinchun (CN, former), Chen Yu (CN, current), Shi Xin (Cantonese), Meaghan Martin (EN) and Lee Sae-byeok (KR). Her designer is [[Infukun]].

A former logistical employee of a trading company from Sargon. She joined Rhodes Island to treat the Oripathy that she contracted in a sandstorm during her work.

Despite her engineering qualifications, she displayed outstanding medical knowledge and proficiency in operating relevant tools. Thus she was transferred from the Engineering to the Medical department.

She is socially reclusive, but will prank the operators that she likes. She will get mad if anyone tries to touch the device on her back or the umbrella that she always carries.

Her motif is based on Bactrian [[camel]]s. Her name means "camel" in Kazakh.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nakano Saima (JP), Z-kun (CN) and Han Chae-eon (KR). Her illustrator is [[aZLing]].

title: friston-3_(arknights)
body:
[i]Rhodes Island Defender Robot Friston-3, deployed to the battlefield by Engineer [[Closure (arknights)|]] to participate in combat operations.[/i]

A playable Defender robot operator from [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Produced In:[/td]
      [td]Rhodes Island[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Release Date:[/td]
      [td]November 13[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Manufacturer:[/td]
      [td]Rhodes Island[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]145 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Service Time:[/td]
      [td]Less than 1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An S-C Model four-wheeled Operation Platform constructed by [[Closure (Arknights)|]], and the first product of the Rhodes Island Smart Operation platform R&D Team.

[spoiler]Originally he was [[Friston (Arknights)|Trevor Friston]], one of the survivors of the First Civilization. He volunteered to have his consciousness transferred to a synthetic form as part of the Preserver Project, to keep watch over a group of other First Civilization's survivors.

After the events of [i]Lone Trail[/i], his AI was salvaged by [[Ho'olheyak (Arknights)|]] and offered to [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|]] for asylum. His AI was then installed in the Rhodes Island-made robot known as Friston-3.[/spoiler]

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Ikeda Shuuichi]] (JP), Dong Shengzhang (CN), John Kassir (EN), and Im Chae-bin (KR). His illustrator is [[Rumisher]].

title: james_gordon
body: James W. "Jim" Gordon Sr. is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]], most commonly in association with the superhero [[Batman]]. Created by Bill Finger and Bob Kane as an ally of Batman, the character debuted in the first panel of Detective Comics #27 (May 1939), Batman's first appearance, making him the first Batman supporting character ever to be introduced.

title: heath_ledger
body:
Heath Andrew Ledger (4 April 1979 – 22 January 2008) was an Australian actor. After playing roles in several Australian television and film productions during the 1990s, he moved to the United States in 1998 to further develop his film career. His work consisted of 20 films in a variety of genres, including 10 Things I Hate About You (1999), The Patriot (2000), A Knight's Tale (2001), Monster's Ball (2001), Casanova (2005), Lords of Dogtown (2005), [[Brokeback Mountain]] (2005), Candy (2006), I'm Not There (2007), [[The Dark Knight]] (2008), and The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus (2009), the latter two of which were posthumously released. He also produced and directed music videos and aspired to be a film director.
Ledger died in January 2008 from an accidental overdose as a result of prescription drug abuse. A few months before his death, he finished filming his role as the [[Joker (Dc)|]] in The Dark Knight; the performance brought him praise and popularity, and numerous posthumous awards?

title: brokeback_mountain
body: Brokeback Mountain is a 2005 American neo-Western romantic drama film directed by Ang Lee and produced by Diana Ossana and James Schamus. Adapted from the 1997 short story by Annie Proulx, the screenplay was written by Ossana and Larry McMurtry. The film stars [[Heath Ledger]], Jake Gyllenhaal, [[Anne Hathaway]], and Michelle Williams. Its plot depicts the complex romantic relationship between two American cowboys, Ennis Del Mar and Jack Twist, in the American West from 1963 to 1983.
